# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

Here's a Julia function that transforms a vector of strings into Pig Latin, running each transformation in a separate thread:

```julia
using Base.Threads

function pig_latinify(words::Vector{String})
    transformed_words = Vector{String}(undef, length(words))
    @sync begin  # synchronize the completion of spawned threads
        for (i, word) in enumerate(words)
            @spawn begin  # run each transformation in a separate thread
                transformed_words[i] = transform_to_pig_latin(word)
            end
        end
    end
    return transformed_words
end

function transform_to_pig_latin(word::String)
    if isempty(word)
        return word
    end

    # Rule: If word begins with a vowel, add "yay" to the end
    # Rule: If word begins with a consonant, move consonants before the first vowel to the end, and add "ay"
    vowels = Set(['a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u'])
    if word[1] in vowels
        return word * "yay"
    else
        # Find index of the first vowel
        idx_first_vowel = findfirst(c -> c in vowels, word)
        if idx_first_vowel !== nothing
            # Move consonants before the first vowel to the end and add "ay"
            return word[idx_first_vowel:end] * word[1:idx_first_vowel-1] * "ay"
        else
            # No vowels found, so just add "ay" to the end
            return word * "ay"
        end
    end
end
```

using Base.Threads

function pig_latinify(words::Vector{String})
    transformed_words = Vector{String}(undef, length(words))

    # synchronized block to ensure all threads complete before returning the result
    @sync begin
        for (i, word) in enumerate(words)
            @spawn transformed_words[i] = transform_to_pig_latin(word)
        end
    end

    return transformed_words
end

function transform_to_pig_latin(word::String)
    if isempty(word)
        return word
    end

    vowels = "aeiouAEIOU"
    first_letter = first(word)

    if first_letter in vowels
        return word * "yay"
    else
        idx_first_vowel = findfirst(c -> c in vowels, word)
        if idx_first_vowel !== nothing
            return word[idx_first_vowel:end] * lowercase(word[1:idx_first_vowel-1]) * "ay"
        else
            return word * "ay"
        end
    end
end
